intro: Aizoon africanum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with thick, fleshy stems and small, green leaves. It produces yellowish flowers in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Aizoon africanum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
